Package general

Class Event

java.lang.Object
general.Event
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArrivalEvent, EnterEvent, LeaveEvent, PayEvent, PickEvent, QueueEvent
public abstract class Event extends Object
Serves as the base class for all events within the simulation, encapsulating the common functionalities and properties that every event must have. Events are created with a specific execution time and, when executed, can result in the creation of a subsequent event, effectively driving the simulation forward.

The execution time of an event represents the moment it is completed rather than when it started. For example, for a payment event, the time signifies the completion of the payment process.

  • Field Details

    • time

      protected float time
      The execution time of the event. This represents the simulation time at which the event is to be executed, which is interpreted as the completion time of the event's action.

    • nameOfCurrentEvent

      protected String nameOfCurrentEvent
      The name of the current event. This field is used for identifying the event, which can be useful for debugging and logging purposes, helping to understand the flow of events in the simulation.

    • eventTarget

      protected Object eventTarget
      The target object of the event. This is the object upon which the event acts. In this simulation project, it is a customer object, but the design allows for flexibility in the event's target.

    • state

      protected State state
      The current state of the simulation. Events use this reference to modify the state of the simulation, reflecting changes that occur as a result of the event's execution.

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event(float time, Object eventTarget, State state)
      Constructs a new Event with a specified execution time, target, and state.
      Parameters:
      time - The time at which the event is to be executed.
      eventTarget - The target object of the event, in this project only customer.
      state - The current state of the simulation that the event can modify.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public abstract Event execute()
      Executes the event, affecting the simulation state as necessary and possibly generating a subsequent event to be added to the event queue.
      Returns:
      The next event to occur following the execution of this event, or null if no subsequent event is generated.

      Returns:
